item.title: From West End Lane to West Hampstead Station, 2nd December
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally report the ongoing disruption caused by the street works taking place from West End Lane to West Hampstead Station. It has now been over a month since these works began, and the traffic situation has become unacceptable. Every single day, the congestion in this area results in delays of 30 minutes or more, creating a constant traffic jam from early morning onwards. I travel to work by bus through this route, and due to these ongoing delays, I am consistently arriving late. This has now begun to affect my employment, as I am facing salary deductions through no fault of my own. I fully understand that roadworks are sometimes necessary, but the lack of proper traffic management, alternative routing, or timely completion is causing serious disruption to residents, commuters, and workers. The situation has gone on long enough and needs urgent attention. I kindly request that you investigate this matter as soon as possible and take appropriate action to reduce the delays, improve traffic flow, or provide a clear timeline for when this work will be completed. The current situation is simply not sustainable. Thank you for your attention. I look forward to seeing immediate improvements.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 152, West End Lane, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress and Toilet Seat Cover Dumped Again on Wheathill Road, 2nd December
item.description:
A mattress has been dumped on the pavement at Wheathill Road, along with a toilet seat cover left just out of frame. This hotspot is now being used for flytipping almost daily, creating hazards for pedestrians and dragging down the area. It’s unacceptable that such repeated dumping is still happening with no effective deterrent in place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wheathill Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wet slippery leaves on Point Hill, 2nd December
item.description:
No leaf sweeping has taken place this autumn. The top part of Point Hill, leading to West Grove needs clearing as wet soggy leaves are making it slippery for pedestrians.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Maidenstone Hill, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping of manikin leg, 2nd December
item.description:
This morning 2/12/2025 this leg was not there. In the afternoon, at 17:15 I have seen and taken pictures. It is in the front of Baum pharmacy. I am actually surprised that it was not brought to Halley/Celestial Gardens as there fly tipping happens weekly. Rubbish there is removed swiftly by management agency at the expense of residents. I just wander where this leg come from This is unusual item by all means... (average household does not have one legged mainikin.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Lee High Road, Hither Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 85 Chesterfield Grove Flytipping (along the wall) 3rd Complaint, 2nd December
item.description:
This is the 3rd complaint. Additional cardboard has been added, along with the crate/pallet and the cardboard box, that is still there entering the 3rd week. It poses a health and safety hazard for pedestrians aswell as illegal dumping. It is getting out if hand.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inappropriate sign placement creating obstacle and danger to pedestrians, 2nd December
item.description:
This sign is placed on a narrow pavement and is a barrier for pedestrians and particularly those with prams or wheelchairs. At night the black sign is almost invisible to those with some limited vision and is unexpected so far into the footpath on such a narrow section. I have walked into it and believe it is inappropriately placed and should be placed elsewhere where the pavement is wider.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 131, South Lambeth Road, Vauxhall, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
